thread.title: Protesters Block "Suffragette" Red Carpet

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Protesters Block "Suffragette" Red Carpet
text:
The red carpet for the Suffragette premiere this evening (October 7) was infiltrated by protesters campaigning to end domestic violence funding cuts. Women from Sisters Uncut wore T-shirts emblazoned with "Dead women can't vote" and lay down on the red carpet prior to the stars arriving.
PROTEST AT THE #Suffragette premiere pic.twitter.com/vQG0nyEwcQ
— ellie henman (@ellie_henman) October 7, 2015
 Whooooah. Red carpet crashed by budget cut protestors pic.twitter.com/4Wmu3dA3KV
— Beth Webb (@BethKWebb) October 7, 2015
More From Cosmopolitan ! @SistersUncut occupying the red carpet at the suffragette film premiere. pic.twitter.com/aJXPeooA4U
— Reni Eddo-Lodge (@renireni) October 7, 2015
Suffragette review: Carey Mulligan gives an awards-worthy performance
The group's feministo says: "We stand united with all self-defining women who live under the threat of domestic violence, and those who experience violence in their daily lives.
"We stand against the life-threatening cuts to domestic violence services. We stand against austerity."
Their list of demands includes the restoration of funding cuts, guaranteed access to legal aid for women experiencing domestic violence, and the provision of access to safe and secure social housing for women who otherwise cannot afford to flee.
Suffragette stars Carey Mulligan , Helena Bonham Carter, Meryl Streep, Ben Whishaw, Brendan Gleeson and Anne-Marie Duff, and explores women's fight for the right to vote in the 1910s.
